title: Classic Waffles Recipe (with Video)
description: These crispy waffles are easy to make with simple ingredients you probably already have on hand for a light and fluffy breakfast treat.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Waffle Recipes Classic Waffles 4.6 (4,150) 3,162 Reviews 922 Photos These waffles turn out lovely and crispy. Perfect for any day of the week! Submitted by Megan Updated on October 11, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 922 922 922 922 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 5 Yield: 10 waffles Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 5 servings 2 cups all-purpose flour 1 teaspoon salt 4 teaspoons baking powder 2 tablespoons white sugar 2 large eggs 1 ¬Ω cups warm milk ‚Öì cup butter, melted 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix flour, salt, baking powder, and sugar together in a large bowl; set aside. Preheat waffle iron to desired temperature. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Beat eggs in a separate bowl; stir in milk, butter, and vanilla. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour milk mixture into flour mixture; beat until blended. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Ladle batter into a preheated waffle iron. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook waffles until golden and crisp. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve immediately and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 10,393 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 379 Calories 16g Fat 48g Carbs 10g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 5 Calories 379 % Daily Value * Total Fat 16g 21% Saturated Fat 9g 47% Cholesterol 113mg 38% Sodium 899mg 39% Total Carbohydrate 48g 17% Dietary Fiber 1g 5% Total Sugars 9g Protein 10g 20% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 267mg 21% Iron 3mg 17% Potassium 196mg 4% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Classic Waffles 01 of 922 Photo by¬† Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 922 Photo by¬† Garnet70 01/12/2025 A keeper! Easy to follow Great flavors This recipe turns out perfectly. It‚Äôs not bitter or salty as some people say but if you think it is, reduce the baking soda or salt. I think the prescribed amounts of each make a crispy, tasty waffle.I made exactly 4 PAIRS of waffles with my Cuisinart waffle maker. Love that it worked out so nearly. I logged this recipe in MacroFactor and they were 473 per pair. 03 of 922 Photo by¬† Therese G Upperman 01/01/2025 A keeper! Easy to follow Worth the effort Great flavors Easy to make and so worth it! 04 of 922 Photo by¬† DapperBoba9811 10/20/2024 A keeper! Family favorite Easy to follow I substitute 1:1 maple syrup for sugar and water for milk then add a dash of cinnamon. Sometimes for a new flavor I sub 1:1 almond extract for vanilla. 05 of 922 Photo by¬† Nelly Knitter 08/16/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Worth the effort Very good recipe. They all came out perfect from the very first one. I didn't have milk but I mixed cream with hot water. I'm going to freeze the extras and then have them when I want one! 06 of 922 Photo by¬† Melissa Novella 07/29/2024 Family favorite Simple recipe that can be jazzed up with "add-ins", such as blueberries, bananas, chocolate chips, etc. I use about 1/4 cup whole wheat flour (minus 1/4 cup AP flour) & a scoop of protein powder because my son plays AAA hockey 07 of 922 Photo by¬† lena mays 06/21/2024 OK with tweaks This is the 2nd time I've made this recipe. This time I added only 1 TBL of sugar. I also separated my egg whites and whipped them, then folded in the complete batter. This makes for a very fluffy waffle. I make a big batch, then freeze them for the toaster. They are 100% better than Eggos. 08 of 922 Photo by¬† FeistyPeach1808 06/16/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Worth the effort Family favorite Easy to follow This is the best waffle recipe ever! I have tried many. These waffles are crispy on the outside and fluffy in the middle. When I take them out of the waffle maker, I stand them up for about a minute, so they stay crispy. Just like on the picture. üòç I will never use any other recipe for waffles! Thank you! 09 of 922 Photo by¬† LovingJam3675 05/19/2024 This waffle recipe is so delicious; Light and fluffy waffles with just the right amount of sweetness. I put a tablespoon of vanilla. The individual who commented that they are inedible because of too much baking Soda should recheck the recipe. It calls for baking powder. It may just change their opinion/rating of this recipe. These waffles freeze perfectly as well. 10 of 922 Photo by¬† Steven Bulin 05/05/2024 Good waffle! name: Megan
instructions: Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Mix flour, salt, baking powder, and sugar together in a large bowl; set aside. Preheat waffle iron to desired temperature. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Beat eggs in a separate bowl; stir in milk, butter, and vanilla. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Pour milk mixture into flour mixture; beat until blended. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Ladle batter into a preheated waffle iron. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Cook waffles until golden and crisp. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Serve immediately and enjoy!
